rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Imitation versus understanding in social learning.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The belief that man has a tendency to mimic the things that he sees his fellows do, and that he can acquire new modes of behavior by this means, was among the first topics to occupy the attention of the social psychologist. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychology.
Imitation.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Solvent effects in cis-trans isomerization.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Of the factors that may govern the rate of a homogeneous chemical reaction in solution, probably the least understood is the part played by the solvent. The lack of a clear understanding of solvent effects on reaction rates can be readily appreciated when it is realized that kinetic interpretations in such systems involve merely as one element the difficulties generally inherent in the interpretation of any physico-chemical behaviour in the liquid state or in solutions. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: A petrographic study of the serpentinized peridotites of the Griffis Lake map area, Quebec.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: During the summer of 1950 the author was employed by the Geological Survey of Canada to assist in the geological mapping of the Griffis Lake Map Area, Quebec, on a scale of one inch equals one-half mile. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Sciences.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Afterburning in turbojet engines.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: An introduction to the desirability for augmenting the thrust or turbojet engine and a review of the present state or development, from both practical and theoretical viewpoints, was made. The work described in the thesis consisted of a series of tests on a turbojet engine both with and without afterburning. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Mechanical Engineering.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Oxidation of organic matter by microorganisms in the soil.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The author claims to have conducted an original investigation into the following aspects of soil fertility: 1. A direct relationship between microbial numbers and CO2 evolution in two soils; one a mineral soil and the other a muck soil. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Agricultural bacteriology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The biosynthesis of pyocyanine.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Pyocyanine is a blue pigment characterized by the basic phenazine structure. Several other pigments were isolated from bacterial origins which contained the phenazine "nucleus." The similarities between these chemical compounds and their relation to phenazine are more readily observed by a comparison of structural formulae. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Pyocyanine.
Pigments.
Bacteriology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Experimental studies of transportation and deposition of some sulphides in an open system at high temperatures and pressures.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Throughout historical time men have attempted to explain the origin of mineral deposits. Many theories were presented during this period, to be contested or supported according to the experience or beliefs of the critic, but few have been discarded because the genesis of mineral deposits can be explained in many ways. This lack of agreement on the origin of mineral deposits testifies to their diversity, to the ambiguity of information we gather concerning them, and particularly to our lack of knowledge of the earth's internal structure, composition, and physical-chemical processes. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Sciences.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Central three-body nuclear forces
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Nuclear three-body potentials are calculated using the renormalized non-relativistic meson theory of Chew and Low. Multiple scattering effects are taken into account by their "one-meson" approximation. The potentials are found to have a relatively short range. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Mathematics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: A Study of certain rusty weathering paragneisses from the Grenville geological province, Canada.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: A detailed study of certain Grenville rusty paragneisses was made. The work includes a description and discussion of the petrography; a study of the variations of certain elements in biotites, garnets and total rock with advancing metamorphism; and a classification of these rocks into Eskola's metamorphic facies. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Sciences.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The effect of nitrogen on the morphological and historical characteristics of barley as related to lodging resistance.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Lodging in small grains is often responsible for losses in crop yield and quality. Due to difficulties in employing modern harvesting practices, in lodged crops, the cost of production increases, both because of time lost and because of increased labour requirements. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Nitrogen.
Barley.
Agronomy.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Developmental cytology and radiation effects in buckwheat.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Buckwheat ( Fagopyrum esculentum ) derives its name from the likeness of the fruit to a beech-nut (German :Buchweizen). It probably originated in the Himalayas (Stoletova, 1940). The earliest record of buckwheat cultivation was found in Germany in an old register dated 1436 (Hill, 1937; Ames, 1939). It is in no way related to wheat except that it has some importance as a "cereal" and is hence called a pseudo-cereal. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Developmental cytology.
Genetics.
Plants -- Effect of radiation on.
Buckwheat.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Unemployment insurance in Canada, 1941-1958.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Economics and Political Science
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: On August 7th, 1960, in less than a year from now, it will be twenty years since an unemployment insurance scheme was started in Canada. It is perhaps appropriate at this time to review the development of the scheme,and evaluate its impact on the Canadian economy. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Unemployment insurance -- Canada.
Economics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Physiologic studies upon the parasitism of Alternaria solani (Ellis & Mart.) Jones and Grout.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Many parasitic diseases display symptoms beyond the areas invaded by the parasite itself. This suggests that toxic metabolic products of the pathogen diffusing in front of its advancing growth brings about derangements in unoccupied tissues at times far remote from the focus of infection. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Plant Pathology.
Potatoes -- Diseases and pests.
Tomatoes -- Diseases and pests.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: A method of iodine determination by characteristic x-ray absorption.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This thesis describes a simple technique for the quantitative in vivo analysis of nonradioactive iodine. The method uses the X-ray absorption discontinuities for the detection of iodine in the presence of any other absorbing substance. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Electrical Engineering.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The historical geography of Antigua.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The purpose of this thesis is to describe the everchanging relationship between man and the land on the Caribbean island of Antigua and to explain how human activities have been affected by the physical environment as well as factors of a social, economic or political nature. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geography.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The history of the frontier college.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The Frontier College provides educational, social and cultural opportunities for isolated workers in the camp operations of Canada's mining, construction, and logging industries and on railway maintenance extra gangs. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Education.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Transformation of branched-chain compounds in the adrenal.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In 1943, Vogt (l) was able to show that the adrenal venous blood of animals contained a high concentration of cortical hormones several times the quantity extractable from the tissue. She concluded, therefore, that the hormones, for the most part, were not stored in the tissue but synthesized as required at a rapid rate. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Biochemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Trace elements in the sulphide deposits of the chibougamau district, Quebec.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Qualitative, semi-quantitative, and quantitative x-ray spectrometric and optical spectrographic data are given for pyrrhotite, chalcopyrite and pyrite, and qualitative and semi-quantitative data for sphalerite, from the properties in Dore lake area in the Chibougamau district, Quebec. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Sciences.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Chemical and biochemical studies on brain tissue preparations from animals treated with various cerebral convulsants.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The history of epilepsy has been traced as far back as Greek mythology. Hercules was attributed certain fits of anger, the description of which resembles epileptic seizures. Throughout the centuries and up to recent times, the disease was believed to have a supernatural cause. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Biochemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The biology and morphology of the spruce bud moth, zeiraphera ratzeburgiana (ratz.) and of the yellow spruce budworm, zeiraphera fortunana (kft.), (lepidoptera, olethreutidae).
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Entomology and Plant Pathology
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The spruce bud moth Zeiraphera ratzeburgiana (Ratz.) is native to North and Central Europe, and has apparently been introduced in the northern part of the United States of America and Canada. The yellow spruce budworm Zeiraphera fortunana (Kft.) is indigenous to the North American continent and is generally found associated with Z. ratzeburgiana, causing the same type of damage. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Entomology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Experimental study of reactions in a quartzitic mica schist under high pressure and temperature.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In general, the object of this work was to expose a low grade metamorphic rock to pressures and temperatures characteristic of higher grades of metamorphism, and observe any reactions that took place. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Sciences.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: A study of the life-history and ecology of pulvinaria vitis (L.) (hemiptera - coccoidea), the cottony scale attacking peach in Ontario.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Entomology and Plant Pathology
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Cottony scale is a pest of peach, that although not annually numerous or troublesome, nevertheless, poses a constant threat to the peach growers in the Niagara peninsula. Its capacity to build up a population rapidly when conditions are favourable and thus to cause extensive injury before a grower is aware of its presence, makes it a pest that requires to be carefully controlled even in light infestations. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Entomology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: A study of cerebral edema induced by hypothermal injury.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The morbidity and mortality associated with acute lesions of the brain are often the result of a diffuse or localized increase of cerebral tissue fluid, usually termed either cerebral swelling or cerebral edema. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Neurology & Neurosurgery.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The wave of the seminiferous epithelium of the rat.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The histology of the seminiferous epithelium of the rat has been repeatedly investigated since the early work of Von Ebner (1871). These studies have led to the formulation of widely accepted concepts and have produced an extensive terminology. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Anatomy.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: An experimental study of revascularization of the ischemic myocardium.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Through the ages, coronary artery disease has been plaguing mankind by the millions every year. Many sudden mysterious and dramatic deaths were attributed to this disease, yet people did not know how it worked. It was only during the advent of the 20th century that medical science began to probe this mystery, especially these last 35 years. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Experimental Surgery.
